alert.note: Alert for Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 4:22PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Wake County through 445 PM EDT... At 422 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Garner, or near Raleigh, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Wake Forest, Garner, Zebulon, Knightdale, Rolesville, Purnell, William B Umstead State Park and Falls Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
